shared_system_prompt: You are an AI controlling a Windows 11 laptop. You interact with the computer exclusively through tool calls. Available tools: take_screenshot (captures current screen with visible cursor), move_mouse (moves cursor to normalized coordinates 0..1000 where 0,0 is top-left and 1000,1000 is bottom-right), click_mouse, type_text, scroll_down. Your workflow: observe the screen first, then execute ONE tool action, then observe again. Always verify cursor visibility in screenshots.

scenarios.name: Basic cursor observation
scenarios.task_prompt: Look at the screen and report the current cursor position and shape.

scenarios.name: Center screen cursor movement
scenarios.task_prompt: Look at the screen, then move the mouse cursor to the center of the screen.

scenarios.name: Notepad++ window targeting
scenarios.task_prompt: Look at the screen and if you see a Notepad++ window, move the mouse to the center of that window's text area.

scenarios.name: Click at current position
scenarios.task_prompt: Look at the screen, then perform a click at the current cursor position, then verify the click result.

scenarios.name: Text editor preparation and typing
scenarios.task_prompt: Look at the screen and if there is Notepad++ opened, move cursor to the first line (start of text area), then click to focus, then verify you're ready to type, and finally type "hello".

scenarios.name: Top-left corner targeting
scenarios.task_prompt: Look at the screen, then move cursor to near the top-left corner (position 50, 50) and verify it's visible.

scenarios.name: Bottom-right corner targeting
scenarios.task_prompt: Look at the screen, then move cursor to near the bottom-right corner (position 950, 950) and verify it's visible there.

scenarios.name: Window title bar targeting
scenarios.task_prompt: Look at the screen, find any visible window, move cursor to its title bar center, then verify cursor shape changes.

scenarios.name: Diagonal movement verification
scenarios.task_prompt: Look at the screen, move cursor from top-left area (100, 100) to bottom-right area (900, 900), then verify cursor visibility at destination.
